org.webmacro.as
Interface TypeHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
CompositeTypeHandler, SimpleTypeHandler
public interface TypeHandler

Common empty interface for type handlers. Before an action method is invoked, each parameter value is passed to the assigned type handler, which performs the conversion of HTTP parameter value to a value of a Java type.

Note: ActionServlet has defined type handlers for all primitive types, java.lang.String and org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext.

Example: Before the action method: 

 public int doSomething(String str, int number) {
    // ...
 }
is called, two (internal) type handlers are invoked: one for java.lang.String and one for int.

Custom type handlers

A type handler is a class that implements either SimpleTypeHandler or CompositeTypeHandler.

Bindng between the parameter type and its type handler is done by the <type-handler> element in ActionConfig: 

  <type-handler type="some.package.Type"
                class="some.package.TypeHandler"/>
Example: 
  <type-handler type="java.util.Date"
                class="my.package.DateHandler"/>

See Also:
ActionServlet
